titlestmt.titleproper: New York Irish History Roundtable Records AIA.018
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Bonnie Gordon

publicationstmt.publisher: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archive

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2014-06-25T11:27-0400

did.unittitle: New York Irish History Roundtable Records

repository.corpname: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archive

did.physloc: Materials are stored off-site and advance notice is required for use. Please contact tamiment.wanger@library.nyu.edu at least two days prior to research visit.

bioghist.head: Historical/Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Since 1984 the New York Irish History Roundtable has encouraged research and provided a forum for historians and genealogists sharing an interest in the history of the Irish in New York City.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: Any rights (including copyright and related rights to publicity and privacy) held by the New York Irish History Roundtable, the creator of this collection, were transferred to New York University in 2004. Permission to publish or reproduce materials in this collection must be secured from the Tamiment Library.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition note
acqinfo.p: In 2004, the New York Irish History Roundtable sent a gift of 10 cubic feet. Additional donations were received in 2009. The accession numbers associated with this collection are 1997.049, 2012.083, and 2012.088.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This unprocessed collection consists of the papers of the New York Irish History Roundtable, including photographs, the files of former officers, copies of the organization's journal and newsletter, materials documenting special events, materials concerning the Gaelic Gotham exhibit at the Museum of the City of New York in the mid 1990s, and administrative files concerning the publication of The New York Irish edited by Ronald H. Bayor and Timorthy J. Meagher (1996).
